intro: Trichocentrum × cicyi, commonly known as the hybrid orchid, is a hybrid species resulting from the cross between Trichocentrum loddigesii and Trichocentrum cincinnatiense. It is a epiphytic orchid native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. The plant features long, arching inflorescences that bear numerous fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are strap-like,革质 (leathery), and arranged in a spiral pattern around the stem. Trichocentrum × cicyi is valued in horticulture for its ornamental flowers and ease of cultivation.
